project.name: project_blank
project.notes: This project features a FizzBuzz script and a recursive factorial block that you can run and debug inside Snap! and also compile into various text-based programming languages: * JavaScript * Smalltalk * Python * C Enjoy! -Jens

block-definition.translations: pt:os dados JSON _ em formato de lista
pt:a resposta a _ de _ enviando _ e cabeçalhos _

block-definition.comment: Reports a three-item list containing the latitude and longitude of the user, and the precision of the measurements. Works only if the user allows snap.berkeley.edu access to location data. Some browsers also require an HTTPS connection to Snap!.

custom-block.s: set front left motor power to %n
set front right motor power to %n
set back left motor power to %n
set back right motor power to %n

block.l: def fact(n): if n <= 1: return 1 return int(n) * fact(int(n) - 1)
def fib(n): if n <= 2: return 0 return fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)

block-definition.header: def fact(n): if n <= 1: return 1 return int(n) * fact(int(n) - 1)
def fib(n): if n <= 2: return 0 return fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)

block-definition.s: set front left motor power to %'power'
set front right motor power to %'power'
set back left motor power to %'power'
set back right motor power to %'power'
